column2: Indicator
column7: dataSource2
column10: description
column11: chartComment

column2: On-time high school graduation
column7: School District of Philadelphia
column10: Percentage of all students who graduate from high school within four years after starting 9th grade.
column11: Data are by school year. For example, 2005 refers to the school year spanning fall 2005 and spring 2006.

column2: Adults completing some college, ≥25 years of age
column10: Percentage of adults 25 years or older who completed at least some college.

column2: Unemployment, ≥16 years of age
column10: Percentage of population 16 years or older unemployed but seeking work.

column2: Poverty
column10: Percentage of population with an income below 100% of the federal poverty level.

column2: Children living in poverty, <18 years of age
column5: US Census Bureau Small Area Income and Poverty Estimates
column7: US Census \ American Community Survey
column10: Percentage of children under 18 with a family income below 100% of the federal poverty level.

column2: Children in single-parent households, <18 years of age
column10: Percentage of all children in family households that live in a household headed by a single parent (male or female head of household with no spouse present).

column2: Premature death
column7: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
column10: Premature death is represented by the years of potential life lost before age 75 (YPLL-75). YPLL is an age-adjusted rate per 100,000 population.

column2: Poor or fair health
column7: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
column10: Percentage of adults who rate their health as fair or poor in response to the question In general, would you say that your health is excellent, very good, good, fair, or poor?
column11: County figures are adjusted to 2000 population.

column2: Adult smoking prevalence
column7: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
column10: Percentage of adults who have smoked at least 100 cigarettes in their lifetime and currently smoke every day or "some days."
column11: County data reflect adults who smoke every day or "most days."

column2: Teen smoking prevalence, 9th-12th grade
column10: Percentage of 9th-12th grade students who smoked on at least one day in past 30 days.
column11: Bronx and Kings rate is for NYC as a whole. Dallas data is from 2011.

column2: Adult excessive drinking
column7: Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System
column10: Also known as “binge drinking”: for women, consuming 4 or more drinks on a single occasion in the last 30 days; for men, consuming 5 or more drinks on a single occasion in the last 30 days.

column2: Teen excessive drinking, 9th-12th grade
column10: Percentage of 9th-12th grade students who had 5 or more alcoholic drinks in a row within a couple hours on at least one day in past 30 days.
column11: Bronx and Kings rate is for NYC as a whole. Dallas data is from 2011.

column2: Teen obesity prevalence, 9th-12th grade
column10: Percentage of 9th-12th grade students with BMI greater than or equal to 95th percentile for their sex and age group.
column11: Bronx and Kings rate is for NYC as a whole. Dallas data is from 2011.

column2: Adult obesity prevalence
column7: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
column10: Percentage of adults with BMI greater than or equal to 30kg/m2. NOTE: County figures are for adults 20 years and older.

column2: Teens drinking ≥1 sugary drink daily, 9th-12th grade
column10: Percentage of 9th-12th grade students who drank soda at least once a day for past 30 days.
column11: Bronx and Kings rate is for NYC as a whole. Dallas data is from 2011.

column2: Premature cardiovascular disease (CVD) mortality rate per 100,000
column5: Interactive Atlas of Heart Disease and Stroke, National Center for Health Statistics
column10: Age-adjusted rate per 100,000 persons of CVD deaths to persons under 65 years of age.

column2: Adult hypertension prevalence
column7: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
column10: Percentage of adults who have been told they have been told by a doctor or other health professional that they have high blood pressure or hypertension. Excludes respondents with a history of gestational hypertension only.
column11: National level data is from the National Center for Health Statistics, 2011-2012

column2: Adult diabetes prevalence
column7: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
column10: Percentage of adults who have been told by a doctor or other health professional that they have or have had diabetes. Excludes respondents with a history of gestational diabetes only.
column11: National level data is from the CDC National Diabetes Statistics Report, 2014

column2: New HIV diagnoses per 100,000
column5: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, HIV Surveillance Report
column10: Rate of new HIV diagnoses per 100,000 population.
column11: Bronx and Kings rate is for NYC as a whole.

column2: Teens who used condom with last sexual encounter, 9th-12th grade
column10: Percentage of sexually active 9th-12th grade students who reported using a condom during the most recent sexual intercourse. Respondents are considered sexually active if they report intercourse with at least one person in the three months preceding the survey.
column11: Bronx and Kings rate is for NYC as a whole. Dallas data is from 2011.

column2: Teens who used birth control with last sexual encounter, 9th-12th grade
column10: Percentage of sexually active 9th-12th grade students who used some form of birth control during the most recent sexual intercourse. Respondents are considered sexually active if they report intercourse with at least one person in the three months preceding the survey.
column11: Bronx and Kings rate is for NYC as a whole. Dallas data is from 2011.

column2: Teen births per 1,000, 15-19 years of age
column7: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
column10: Birth rate per 1,000 teen girls age 15-19 years.

column2: Infant mortality rate per 1,000 live births
column7: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
column10: Mortality rate per 1,000 live-born infants under one year of age.
column11: National level data is from the National Vital Statistics, 2013.

column2: Low birth weight births
column7: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
column10: Percentage of live-born infants weighing less than 2,500 grams or 5 pounds 8 ounces at birth.
column11: National level data is from the National Vital Statistics, 2013.

column2: Children up to date on immunizations, 19-35 months of age
column7: Division of Disease Control, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
column10: Percentage of children 19-35 months completing recommended vaccination schedule 4:3:1:3 (DTaP : IPV : MMR : Hib).
column11: Bronx and Kings rate is for NYC as a whole.

column2: Child mortality rate per 100,000, <18 years of age
column7: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
column10: Age-adjusted mortality rate per 100,000 children under 18.
column11: National level data is from Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, 2011-2013

column2: Adults without insurance, 18-64 years of age
column5: US Census Bureau Small Area Health Insurance Estimates
column7: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
column10: Percentage of adults 18-64 years reporting no source of insurance.
column11: National level data is from the Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System, 2013.

column2: Children without insurance, <18 years of age
column5: US Census Bureau Small Area Health Insurance Estimates
column7: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
column10: Percentage of children under 18 for whom no source of insurance is reported by adult proxy.
column11: Small Area Health Insurance Estimates (SAHIE) for counties are based on data from a variety of sources and may not be based on survey data. National level data is from the US Census Bureau Current Population Survey, 2013.

column2: Adults forgoing care due to cost, 18-64 years of age
column7: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
column10: Percentage of adults 18-64 years answering "yes" to the question In the past year, has there been any time when you were sick or injured AND did not seek health care because of the cost?
column11: County figures are for all adults, including those 65 years and older, and are based on responses to the question Was there a time in the past 12 months when you needed to see a doctor but could not because of cost? National level data is from the Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System, 2013.

column2: Adults with colonoscopy or sigmoidoscopy in lifetime, 50-74 years of age
column7: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
column10: Percentage of adults 50-74 years reporting ever having had a colonoscopy or sigmoidoscopy.
column11: County figures are for all adults 50 years and older.

column2: Women with mammography in past 2 years, 50-74 years of age
column7: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
column10: Percentage of women 50-74 years reporting having had a mammogram in the past 2 years.
column11: County figures are for all women 50 years and older.

column2: Girls completing 3-dose HPV vaccine, 13-17 years of age
column7: Division of Disease Control, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
column10: Percentage of girls 13-17 years who received 3 doses of HPV vaccine out of all girls 13-17 years in the population. Data are based on local reporting of immunizations provided by clinicians, and some underreporting for adolescents may occur.
column11: Data from the National Immunization Survey are based on self-report and may overestimate immunization rates. Bronx and Kings rate is for NYC as a whole.

column2: Violent crime rate per 100,000
column7: FBI Uniform Crime Reports
column10: Rate per 100,000 persons of reported violent crimes, including murders and non-negligent manslaughters, forcible rapes, robberies, and aggravated assaults.

column2: Homicide mortality rate per 100,000
column7: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
column10: Age-adjusted rate of homicide deaths per 100,000 persons.
column11: National level data is from the FBI Uniform Crime Reports, 2013.

column2: Teens considering suicide in past year, 9th-12th grade
column10: Percentage of 9th-12th grade students who seriously considered attempting suicide in past 12 months.
column11: Bronx and Kings rate is for NYC as a whole. Dallas data is from 2011.
